title: Ticket #7241: Add condor_q -idle to complement condor_q -run
description:
A while ago we proposed a "condor_q -idle" custom print format for ligo. They like this, and would like it to be first class: 

$ condor_q -pr idle.cpf

-- Schedd: submit-3.chtc.wisc.edu : <128.104.100.44:9618?... @ 01/04/17 14:57:55
OWNER                UNIVERSE  STATUS CPUS MEMORY COUNT NumShadowStarts JobIDs
amalkus              Vanilla   Idle    1    1024   69606 undefined       81629705.2394 ... 81635890.8999
amalkus              Vanilla   Idle    1    1024       3 1               81629705.2385 ... 81629705.2390
bxie9                Vanilla   Idle    4    1844       3 1               81635364.78 ... 81635364.80
bxie9                Vanilla   Idle    4    1844     919 undefined       81635364.81 ... 81635364.999
dwu43                Vanilla   Idle    1    2048    9704 undefined       81519428.460 ... 81521174.923
dwu43                Vanilla   Idle    1    2048       1 2               81519428.459
eswright             Vanilla   Idle    1    2000    1000 undefined       81627145.0 ... 81637305.0
eswright             Vanilla   Idle    1    2000       4 1               81626939.0 ... 81637189.0
huling               Vanilla   Idle    1    8704    3344 undefined       81630700.10156 ... 81630700.13499
jnnguyen2            Vanilla   Idle    24   8000    3428 undefined       81067305.354 ... 81067305.3781
mmillican            Vanilla   Idle    36   131072     1 1               81635891.0
nu_mirkarim          Vanilla   Idle    1    1024    2458 undefined       81632726.0 ... 81635274.0
nu_mirkarim          Vanilla   Idle    1    1024      13 1               81632698.0 ... 81632721.0
tamorrell            Vanilla   Idle    1    2048    3995 undefined       81629938.0 ... 81640219.0
tamorrell            Vanilla   Idle    1    2048       7 1               81629928.0 ... 81629937.0
tbechtel             Vanilla   Idle    36   10240      3 2               81373985.11 ... 81373985.13
toczydlowski         Vanilla   Idle    16   8000     151 undefined       81639866.9 ... 81639975.39


idle.cpf
SELECT UNIQUE NOSUMMARY
 Owner         AS OWNER      WIDTH -20
 JobUniverse   AS "UNIVERSE "   PRINTAS JOB_UNIVERSE
 JobStatus     AS STATUS PRINTAS JOB_STATUS_RAW
 RequestCpus   AS CPUS
 RequestMemory AS MEMORY
 JobCount      AS COUNT      PRINTF  %5d
 NumShadowStarts
 JobIDs
WHERE
  JobStatus==1
GROUP BY
  Owner

This custom print format is implicitly an -all-users query, and it does aggregation in the schedd. Neither of these are things that we want to do by default. But if we add condor_q -idle as a new command line option, and allow the default output to be overridden by configuration in the usual way, the we can satisfy them while at the same time doing something sensible for all of our users.

So we will add a new -idle option which will be a -nobatch type query like -run is. It's output will be like this 

-- Schedd: johnkn@crane8.cs.wisc.edu : <128.105.136.34:7107?... @ 09/27/19 11:02:59
 ID       OWNER          UNIVERSE  CPUS MEMORY STARTS LAST_HOST
15864.0   bob            Vanilla      1     70      1 slot1@hostname.cs.edu
15864.1   bob            Vanilla      1    900      0 undefined
15864.2   bob            Vanilla      1     70      0 undefined

A custom print format for -idle can be configured using something like this 

config fragment
Q_DEFAULT_IDLE_PRINT_FORMAT_FILE = $(ETC)/idle.cpf
